website_summaries.verdict: The Samsung 840 Pro lives up to its name: it's a top-notch solid-state drive for professionals with a price to match.
pros: The Samsung 840 Pro offers fast performance and uses significantly less energy than other solid-state drives
cons: The Samsung 840 Pro is comparatively expensive

customer_reviews.title: Great....but.....
customer_reviews.text: If you order this, you will find that you cannot install it right out of the box. You must purchase a carrier, and a transfer cable to accomplish the task. I did not know this as I thought all would be included. An extra 4 days was required to get all through PRIME. In addition when you call Samsung, no one can help you to install it. You will have to go to Youtube to see a video of how to do it. Watch it on one machine while you install on the other. Good Luck, This is not clear as a bell but, it will help you save time.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Prince

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 Days
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product for 3 days. It was fast, fast. Sadly, after 3 days it crashed my accounting program and scrambled my iTunes files, deleting 80% of them. This, in a perfectly operating Apple iMac that had functioned without error for two years with the original HDD. Reading other reviews here, my guess is that there is a peculiar 'infant mortality' problem with this product that shows up in only a small percentage of new units. I was just unlucky. Really grateful for Amazon's return policy . . . otherwise I would have been stuck with a defective unit and out nearly $500.
customer_reviews.author: lugesm

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic performance
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I bought my 13" Core-i5 Sony Vaio Z Series, its built-in SSD has spoiled me. Further, my "little" Sony ran rings around my much more powerful Core-i7 Apple MacBook Pro! But no longer. I finally got sufficiently frustrated waiting for my MBP to boot, load complex apps (e.g. Visual Studio, Photoshop, etc.) that I bit the bullet and purchased the 840Pro SSD. It took a couple of minutes to fit and a day or so to re-install all my software, but the performance difference is already saving me a lot of time and unnecessary waiting. HIGHLY recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Turner

customer_reviews.title: So much faster than the old spinning technology
customer_reviews.text: Wow. SSD drives are fast! I repair computers for people, and the two most common things I do to upgrade an aging computer is double the amount of RAM, and replace the old HDD with a new SSD. The drives are not inexpensive, but when people see how quickly they are able to start up the computer, move file, and open programs, they are able to forgo buying a new computer for a few years. So spend a few hundred dollars on RAM and an SSD, or pay a thousand dollars for a new computer.
customer_reviews.author: Active Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Unit performs beautifully. Windows 7 boots up FAST on a Lenovo ThinkPad (Core i7) W530 laptop running Windows 7. SSD does have limited write cycles. Will have to wait and see how long it would last. It would be difficult to go back to traditional hard drives once I am used to the speed. The Pro Series consumes less power than the less expensive option EVO series. But I do not think less power consumption gains anything noticeable on laptop. I would likely to go with EVO series for future upgrades. Was considering replacing desktop drives as well, but decided not to. Desktop running 10k Raid 0 is pretty fast already.
customer_reviews.author: Ray T.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Samsung's SSD's are expensive in general but the performance cannot be denied. The speed and performance of this card will blow you away. I upgraded from a HDD and there is simply no comparison. The load times are phenomenal and it greatly improved the HDD bottleneck I was experiencing before. Games and windows in general load so much faster. Keep in mind that when you buy a SSD, you should seriously consider buying a power backup such as a UPS to prevent damage to your SSD investment due to power surges/outages.
customer_reviews.author: EJ Tom

customer_reviews.title: The hard drive itself is an excellent replacement product for the old mechanical hard drive for ...
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive itself is an excellent replacement product for the old mechanical hard drive for the MacBook Pro 17 inch 2010 model, but received the wrong the Samsung model number. I would have given a 5 star, if I had received the correct product. Satisfied with the quick delivery and the product of the order.
customer_reviews.author: ADD

customer_reviews.title: TRUE POTENTIAL! My processor has finally come alive!
customer_reviews.text: Blazin' fast! My boot times are only a third of what they were before, same with shutdown times; granted WIN8 is fairly fast on startup and shutdown to begin with. Before startup-23 secs - After 8 secs; Shutdown before-17 secs - after-6 secs. DEF recommend if anyone wants to see the true potential of their processor; Im only running the Intel Core i5-3230M, not bad for an on-a-budget-in-a-hurry...I can now click on as many apps as I possibly can and it just starts opening every single one of them without hesitation. In conjunction with the Corsair Vengeance 8GB(4GB x2) ram that I installed with the SSD, everything is lightning fast. I have absolutely NO complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Tdavis2welder

customer_reviews.title: Samsung 840 Pro 512GB
customer_reviews.text: I now have four SSDs internal in my Mac Pro. They are mounted on Apricorn Velocity Duo x2 PCIe Cards. All the SSDs are Samsung. One is an original series 840, two are 840 EVOs, the the fourth is the 840 Pro. Frankly I expected the Pro would be a little faster than the EVOs, but it is not. If I had it to do over again, I probably would have gone with another EVO. But the Pro series contain MLC NAND vs the TLC that is in the original 840 and the EVO. MLC is supposed to be more robust, faster, and is expected to last longer. The Pro is my main drive, hence my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Lowrider

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, hands down!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a regular 1tb hard drive, and man i can see the difference. I specifically use my computer for playing games like WoW, Starcraft, and indie games on steam like Contagion, and i can say the loading screens are simply faster, the boot up time from clicking launch, to getting right into the game itself has shattered my expectations. Because the rest of my rig still isn't top of the line like this piece, i know it could be a little faster, but 5 second loading screens, 30 second from completely off, to on boot up time, and instant open firefox is amazing. I would def recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: It's only made a bit more sweet by the newer Samsung 850 Pro's which have 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these in a RAID 0 and my Mac Pro tower is very responsive. Applications load much faster than spinning hard drives. I am getting over 500 MB/s Read and Write in this RAID setup. That's fast enough to work with some of the most demanding footage out there, my choice, R3D files from the RED cameras. I've had these drives for at least 9 months, no issues. Plus a 5 year warranty. It's only made a bit more sweet by the newer Samsung 850 Pro's which have 10 year warranty! Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a Dell XPS laptop. The increase in performance is amazing. In the past I would put the computer into sleep mode to save myself time booting, Not I just shut it off and boot when I need the computer. Boot time is well under one minute. As a professional photographer I copy 1000's of photos to my laptop at an event or shoot. I was blown away by how much faster cards can be ingested during an event. Updating caption info on a 1500 files was always a PIA and would take forever. Now I can re-caption an entire game in under a minute and a half. An incredible time saver!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Canha

customer_reviews.title: This is the SSD drive to look at!
customer_reviews.text: Much time and research in various SSD manufacturers. The Samsung seemed to come highly recommended from a performance standpoint. While not the cheapest drive on the block, the performance numbers were very good and given the fact I intended to use this for several years it seemed worth the additional investment. I am using in it a Mac Mini and have been delighted with the results, it makes the system a joy to use, very fast boot up times, applications launch instantly and no lag or delays while waiting for the system. Installation was a breeze and I have gotten nothing but solid performance from it. Highly recommended, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Dog

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from you Hard Disk Drive IMMEDIATELY.
customer_reviews.text: Dropped it right into my Late 2011 17" MBP with no issues whatsoever. The difference in boot time and the time it takes to open programs is night and day from the HDD to this HDD. I am so satisfied with the performance thus far I would recommend for any of you that hem and haw about decisions that if you are still on a HDD in your system, make the leap to this. You'll kick yourself for not making the leap sooner. My boot time has gone down from 45 seconds (and on many days more) to around 8 to 14 seconds. No kidding. It's that big a difference.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Amazing SSD: Absolutely stunning upgrade from 7200rpm HDD
customer_reviews.text: I finally gave in and upgraded my laptop's 7200rpm hard drives for two of these, and whoa! These things are smokin'. I bought a powerful gaming laptop to do some heavy number crunching (not for gaming, sorry :), and the hard drives have always been the greatest bottlenecks in the performance of my IO-bound applications. These SSD's are a little pricey, but if you can afford them and need them, the upgrade is very well worth the money. The performance penalty of reading and writing to the hard drives is still noticeable, but it is plenty fast enough to make processing a few hundred Gb feasible in a reasonable amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Dylon

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm in my MAC Book Pro
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the dying old style hard drive in my MAC Pro laptop. It actually arrived on Sunday via the US Post Office. (no wonder they are loosing money) Anyway had it in stalled and it works GREAT MAC Book Pro now boots up in less that 15 seconds with the new MAC O/S 10.10.1 Yosemite OS Old drive took over a minute. I have been told by those that are supposed to know tha tthe Samsung Hard Drives are the best and these are what MAC puts in their systems originally from the factory. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: James W Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD but a little overkill if you are using ...
customer_reviews.text: Great SSD but a little overkill if you are using it on older computers that cannot take full advantage of the interface. The only good thing is when I move up to a "better" computer I am going to transplant the 840 to it using the Apricorn SATA wire notebook hard drive upgrade kit. I also purchased the 850 version but cannot see the difference in the computer speed at boot up or opening applications, due to the slow computer interface.
customer_reviews.author: d2f

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Cheap, Just Works.
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced my 840 Pro Series 2.5-inch 256GB for the 512GB, after banging into "disk full" errors over the past few months. No fault of the 256GB drive-- it worked flawlessly. So far, the 512GB version is also running smooth as silk. I used the Apricorn SATA Wire Notebook Hard Drive Upgrade Kit with USB 3.0 Connection to clone my 256GB drive on to the new 512GB drive, without any major hiccups. (And probably next year, I'll wind up buying the 1TB version...)
customer_reviews.author: honzuki

customer_reviews.title: Kicks butt
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my HDD with this SSD and it is a complete difference. Faster booting and faster loading. I will never go back to using a HDD again. Install and run the software that comes with the SSD, it will optimize the settings on your computer so you can more life out of the SSD. Expect to loose about 10% (you can control the size) for Over Provisioning, which helps extend the life of the SSD. I installed this in November of 2014 and it is still kicking butt as of this writing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Skier-man

customer_reviews.title: Nice SSD.  Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and installed it in bay 1 of my Mac Pro 5,1. It didn't seem that fast at first, I was getting all kinds of beech balls, but that was due to spotlight indexing. A couple of days later and it's really quite snappy. Most apps load in under 1 sec. But FCPX takes about 2 seconds. I'm not getting the full benefit of the drive because I'm using a drive bay right now(SATA II). I've ordered an Apricorn Velocity Solo X2 Extreme PCIe caddy that will let this drive breath. Overall it was a great purchase. I'm going to buy another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: CRJ

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace the failed boot drive on my laptop. This has brought the boot time on down to about 10 seconds. I haven't actually timed it but it's fast. My machine has 2 internal drives and I can now tell when the 2nd drive spins up because it's audible. Will probably purchase a 2nd one of these in the future to replace the rest of the spinning rust. Prices keep coming down on these and the performance can't be beat. It remains to be seen what the MTBF is for these things but for now it's doing it's job and it's doing it well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: My first SSD
customer_reviews.text: OMG! This thing is not just fast it is AMAZING! I bought a new laptop top of the line and bought this at the same time. I turned on the laptop and it took a good 30 seconds to load with a standard HD with windows 8. With this new SSD it takes 4 seconds to load the operating system! yes 4 SECONDS! The bios check takes longer than the loading of the software! This is a no brainer! SSD or bust for me in the future! It is expensive but well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: jr

customer_reviews.title: Fast and built to last
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this drive as the boot drive for my Windows 7 computer. I have all of my applications on it. I also use it for video editing and video encoding. All of my documents are stored on regular hard drives. The drive was easy to install. It replaced a 120GB drive that was almost out of space. I was able to restore a backup to the new drive with no issues. The drive is fast. It works as advertised. I plan to order another one to host a few virtual machines.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Moore

customer_reviews.title: *Very* fast, great product
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an OCZ Vertex2 that has died twice with this 840 Pro (512gb) drive. Using various benchmarks, it's clear that this drive is much faster than the Vertex I had (by a factor of 4, and by even more the more I/O I throw at it). I had no trouble with Windows 8 x64 and Ubuntu 13.04 x64 finding it. It didn't come with a bracket to fit it into the 3" or 5.5" bays in my case, but I had a spare one, and it fit in great. I'd definitely recommend this to anyone upgrading from a previous generation SSD. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: this is fantastic. With the HDD I had
customer_reviews.text: Ohmygosh, this is fantastic. With the HDD I had, and Windows 7, it was abominably slow to start up. Even after it 'looked' like it was ready to go, things were opening or working in the background, and it was a shade over seven minutes from press of the power button to actually being able to use the internet. BUT, with the SSD installed as my system drive, and data (pictures, music, documents, whatever) going to the HDD, it's fifty seconds from press of the power button to windows ready to go, and two or three seconds more to be reading Facebook or looking up solutions to the world's problems on Google. Programs open up almost instantly!
customer_reviews.author: OneWouldThink

customer_reviews.title: Nice Performance Boost for Mac Pro
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a Mac Pro 1.1 as the boot drive. I had to get a 2.5 to 3.5 adaptor and because the pins did not line up I also had to get an SATA/Power combo extension. Once it was in I got a HUGE performance boost - more so than the processor upgrade. Applications snap open. It comes with some handy software for moving Windows Data, but for my Mac, I simply mounted both devices and dragged the files to the new drive. Now I'm toying with putting one in my laptop. The power saving alone may be worth the upgrade there.
customer_reviews.author: Αριστείδης

customer_reviews.title: Another fine Samsung product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these that I have gotten, and they make an excellent bootable drive. Very fast, and the provided software (Samsung Magician) is quite helpful. A larger SSD helps in the migration process (they have a migration program, too) and some installation programs won't let you choose anything but C: (some out of necessity and others out of rudeness). If they come down in price a bit, I will try buying two and making a Raid-0 drive out of them. That would be even faster, if you can believe it!
customer_reviews.author: Milo Wadlin

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my macbook pro hard disk drive with this one. I thought it would be faster, but it doesn't seem to be. Bootup and log in all seem to be the same speed, programs however seem to be getting faster, not sure why. Since my old HDD was failing, this was a good purchase and a good price at the time. It should be priced lower at this time. CNET has video on how to install this SSD
customer_reviews.author: Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD but needs better documentation and software
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be fastest SSD currently available. It works great but migration software that came with it did not work at all. OS saw SSD connected thru USB but migration software did not. I used Windows Home Server backup for the migration so this was not a big deal to me but it might be to you. Also the Magician software loads every time you start the computer and documentation does not explain why or whether it is necessary. But good hardware. Computer boots very fast and speeds it up dramatically.
customer_reviews.author: A. Begun

customer_reviews.title: Samsung 840 Pro saved my Mid-2010 macbook pro
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mid 2010 Macbook Pro that was beginning to run very slow. I decided to upgrade to a solid state drive. I first had problems when I purchased a 1TB Crucial drive (it went out in 1 week), I returned it for another that went down even faster. I finally decided on the Samsung 840 Pro 512 GB. Computer flies -- Having an SSD makes virtual memory almost like getting new memory (I'm at my max RAM at 8GB). Before purchasing, I contacted tech support for Samsung, having already been stung by other SSD drives -- the guy I talked to was extremely helpful.
customer_reviews.author: kj

customer_reviews.title: Love Samsung SSD's
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install in my 17" MacBook Pro (early 2011) unibody. With a bit of knowledge all I did was clone my old drive to this and put this one in. The speed increased significantly from my 1TB SSHD (Solid State Hybrid Drive). This is the second time I have bought one of these, last time it was the 128gb and it was installed on a PC. The speed was also significantly improved.
customer_reviews.author: DevilKing

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!! - Point of no return
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! Expensive, but definitely a huge difference for my MacBookPro mid2011. Blackmagicdesigns Disk Speed Test writes above 466MB/s and reads around 516MB/s even with the unit almost full. I know this doesn't affect SSDs as it does HDDs, but it is still important, since both are in real life stuffed with files. So this makes the difference still bigger. Haven't compared to other SSDs, but bought this one after some online research. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Roddan

customer_reviews.title: Up and running in minutes
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the easiest hard drive replacements I've ever experienced. I was imagining a long process of a clean install of my operating system and having to download all of my drivers. I was pleasantly surprised when this was not the case. I plugged this in as a 2nd drive and ran the software install from Samsung. It cloned my existing drive while I was actually in the existing drive's operating system live. The next time I want to replace a SATA drive with an SSD drive I will make sure it is a Samsung. Easiest swap out ever.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie K. Sturtevant

customer_reviews.title: the speed of light in an extremely small and light weight package
customer_reviews.text: nothing short of mind blowing, I got 2 of these babies in RAID0 (RAID 0 is when you get them working together for twice the speed and size of one) it gives me a 1GB/s write and read speeds, using them with intel's built in RAID controller for the Z77 chipset and it's been great since, start up and shut down are almost instant, and my games don't take much time as it used to, and I was using a 10,000 RPM velociraptor 600 GB (RAID 0 same config) and yes it's worth it. only down side is that Samsung's magician software doesn't detect it in RAID mode, have to do it's job manually
customer_reviews.author: Ramy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Performance
customer_reviews.text: After years of traditional hard drives I bought this SDD as my primary hard drive. Very fast read and write performance as of this review. Easy to install and setup just like a normal hard drive. Here are my cautions: The connectors are brittle and do not tolerate heavy handed yanks and tugs. I cracked the connector of my 256GB Samsung SDD when I was trying to make room for this one. But that is my fault. This SDD is a top performer!
customer_reviews.author: dmbTank

customer_reviews.title: This was my best purchase of 2014! Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this HD for my late 2012 Mac Book Pro. The installation was quick and easy so was importing all my data from my old HD. My Mac is now better than when I first bought it. My Mac now boots up in only 15 seconds and all programs, including those heavy such as Adobe Creative Suite boot quickly. Not only does my laptop boot up fast and programs load quicker but also search and retrieval of documents is super fast. This HD has increased production for me and I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Israel C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice hardware, software a little sketchy.
customer_reviews.text: This drive is blazing fast, as many other reviewers will confirm, however, a word of warning: I did NOT succeed in cloning the existing SSD in my thinkpad (with either included or third party software). I had to do a fresh win 8 install. Also, prices are dropping pretty fast these days, so you might consider waiting (I couldn't, because the Thinkpad W530 ("the mobile workstation") maxes out at a fairly pathetic 180GB capacity, and the drive is a fair bit slower that the 840 Pro).
customer_reviews.author: Narada

customer_reviews.title: samsung is the best
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly easy setup, included software allows you to clone prior drive for an easy upgrade, this does not use the intel sandforce controller so it does have have a bug which can cause BSOD problems when going into power saving mode. I had an intel 520 in my computer and didn't learn recently about that unit --using sandforce controller which can crash when shifting to power saving mode. Computer is running better and faster with this . A Worthy upgrade
customer_reviews.author: @youcantseeme

customer_reviews.title: One of the best drives in the market, fast an reliable!
customer_reviews.text: Great drive, reliable used for my work computer and going up to 4700 mts over sea level to a mining company. Box came with everything i needed to switch from a 5.4K to this magnificent drive. My Windows 8.1 computer starts up in less than 15 second, and working with CAD and Adobe huge!!! files this drives shows why it's damn fast and PRO version. If you are looking to buy between this version and Samsung's EVO, guys... spend a couple of dollars more, and buy simple one of the best drives out in the market.
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: Yes Samsung is the best
customer_reviews.text: Windows installed in a small fraction of the time as a hard drive. Now, months later, Windows boots from power off faster than my old disk could start from hibernation. I used the Magician software that comes with it to set 10% of te drive aside for extra reliability just because I'm paranoid. Full virus scan take 1/10 the time. You will be shocked how many programs start almost instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon B. West

customer_reviews.title: Most amazing upgrade ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 17" gaming laptop, with 2 drives, an i7 quad core, 16gb ram, and I always thought it was pretty fast. I'm running windows 7 and boot time took about 1.5 minutes. I bought this drive because I wanted more speed. Lets just say it's amazing. My boot time is now around 20 seconds. This thing is blazing fast. I will never go back to a regular HDD....ever. I was nervous about migrating everything to my new drive, but it was super easy and everything worked after as if I had never done anything. This product is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: S. Simino

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Fast as s***!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was installed int0 a MAC MINI, which is pretty challenging, but that is for another forum. The 840 Pro Series have never let me down. With the SSD the Mini is as fast as any computer I have ever had. I can reboot in seconds, open most of the apps in Adobe's Creative Suite in seconds, and it will open large Ps files (2-3 GB), in you guessed it, seconds. I have the smaller SSD in my laptop, and damn. You just get spoiled by the speed.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: As described. This was very easy to install and is incredibly fast. I have used lower priced units and this one is definitely faster. Note: Just in general, you have to always compare apples to apples. A 512GB drive must be compared to other 512GB drives. You cannot compare a 512gb of one brand to a 120gb of another brand or even the same brand. Unlike traditional hard drives the size of the drive can change all the specs, for the good or bad.
customer_reviews.author: MarkusR

customer_reviews.title: More expensive but more reliable
customer_reviews.text: This SSD is fully compatible with Macbook Pro 104A, Mac Mini 388LL and Dell Latitude E6330. These are the models I use myself. I bought this SSD for installation in Dell system. It took about 6 minutes to clone from a 128 GB SATA SSD I had before. TRIM was enabled, and the partition was offset by 1024x straight from the box. No need to tweak anything. Reviewers say that 840 PRO uses different chip memory from its 840 sibling which allows for many more rewrite cycles, therefore 840 PRO is supposed to be more reliable than 840.
customer_reviews.author: Papasik

customer_reviews.title: Cut load times by more than half!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use as my startup and 'important programs' drive and to speed up my general usage. Computer used to take about 45-60 seconds to go from power button push to desktop ready - now it's ready in about 15-20 seconds. It used to take about 30 seconds to 'wake up' from sleep mode, and now it's almost instantaneous - maybe five seconds. Probably the best computer-related purchase I've made in years. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KE

customer_reviews.title: Fast and stable
customer_reviews.text: I used it for one year in a Toshiba Qosmio laptop running fast, stable and quiet giving new life to the old computer. Now I'm using it in a brand new Toshiba P55 where I got rid of Win 8 and installed Win 7 x64 and now flies! for instance to encode a large amount of wav files to flac with 4 thread in parallel or to encode movies to mkv in h264 and the HDD shows all its strength. Also due to its large capacity (512 GB) I don't needed to move very often all my files to others drives.
customer_reviews.author: PeterCL

customer_reviews.title: A great choice for a new install or an upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hard drive to install in my early-2011 MacBook Pro in place of its current HDD and what a great decision it was. The 840 Pro is easy to install and so, so fast. It used to take my MacBook three or four minutes to load up but now it's one minute, if that. The 840 Pro is a solid, reliable hard drive with quick read and write times. The fact that Samsung is the manufacturer is only more reassuring. I would strongly recommend this SSD for anyone who is building a new desktop or laptop or wants to upgrade their desktop or laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Davi

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive when it was (may still be) one of the highest rated in performance and it was at a fairly reasonable price for the capacity which I needed badly. I cloned an existing smaller SSD without any problem and the drive has worked perfectly since. I don't take the time to do speed testing on my own, but subjectively, it's a very fast drive both reading and writing. I have no complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: H. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Best drive on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this drive for about a year now and I must say this is by far the best ssd I have ever worked with!! Over the course of a year this drive has not slowed one bit.. My laptop with 8.1 boots from the press of the botton to the desktop in 3.5 seconds and I am not exaggerating. This drive has been very reliable and the fastest overall ssd i've used. The speeds advertised are accurate, I have ran several benchmarks. Good job samsung!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome upgrade to complete high performance laptop
customer_reviews.text: After receiving my new MSI gaming laptop, I knew the included 7200rpm 6 GB/S typical hard drive was holding my computer back. Reviews on this SSD were great and I don't regret purchasing it at all. It came with the software necessary to clone my drive and the process worked flawlessly. The price you pay for this kind of performance is worth every penny!! Less than 15 sec to boot and its ready to work! Overall PC performance is increased significantly and I would recommend to anyone who wants a TRUE HIGH PERFORMANCE COMPUTER and/or anyone else who hates to wait for a slow computer.
customer_reviews.author: JWV

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the hdd in my laptop (a 500gb 7200rpm Seagate hdd) for this and, to make the story short, this ssd halved the loading times of the startup and most applications (Lightroom, Photoshop and most games). Things that used to take 10 seconds (like loading Lightroom) now take 4 or 5. Even though my laptop doesn't have a SATA3 interface (just plain old SATA2) and I'm not using it at full speed, this ssd really made a difference.

Capacity:512 GBDesigned for power users and the most demanding applications. the Samsung 840 PRO SSD provides unrivaled read, write and multi-tasking performance. From the world's #1 memory manufacturer, it's time to get the speeds you want and the performance you need.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



Designed for professionals and demanding applications, the SSD 840 PRO provides exceptional read, write, and multi-tasking performance. It's built for the real world, with no moving parts to reduce the risk of damage from shock, while using the latest in security technology including AES 256-bit encryption. Additionally, its ultra-efficient design means increased battery life. This version of the 840 PRO Series SSD has a capacity of 512 GB.




Performs the most demanding computer tasks more quickly than typical hard disk drives and improves battery life in laptops. View larger.





EXCEPTIONAL PERFORMANCE FOR PROFESSIONALS
With Samsung's 840 PRO Series SSD, everyday tasks on your desktop or laptop PC become faster and more responsive, providing workstation-class performance for seamless video editing or the ultimate gaming experience. 

The 840 PRO is capable of delivering quick sequential read and write speeds--up to 540MB/s and 520MB/s respectively--for ultra-fast file transfers. In addition, the SSD features exceptional random speeds with 100K IOPS (read) and 90K IOPS (write) for the fastest real-world performance*. And it provides superior write performance for non-compressible data like images, music, videos and .ZIP files.

ENGINEERED FOR RELIABILITY AND SECURITY
The 840 PRO Series SSD is made to provide consistent, excellent performance through its entire lifetime even under extremely heavy workloads. Like all Samsung SSDs, it is designed and built completely in-house at Samsung using the highest industry standards and advanced Samsung memory technology. And, as with other solid state drives, the 840 PRO has no moving parts, which means no hard-drive spin-ups, no noise, and superior data protection**.

The 840 PRO allows you to keep up with demanding workloads while safeguarding your data. Advanced AES 256-bit ATA full disk encryption provides worry-free data security. And the 4th generation Samsung MDX controller technology and firmware ensures long-term sustained performance under the most punishing conditions. 

THIN, LIGHTWEIGHT DESIGN AND LOW BATTERY CONSUMPTION
At only 7 millimeters thick and weighing just 2 ounces, the 840 PRO Series SSD has a sleek, lightweight design that can make your laptop lighter to carry.

And because it contains no moving parts and features an ultra-efficient design, it consumes little battery power, allowing you to enjoy up to 50 minutes more of laptop battery life than a standard hard disk drive (HDD) or other solid state drive (SSD)***. It also supports Device Sleep mode for Microsoft Windows 8 and Haswell chipsets, which helps reduce overall power consumption.

MAGICIAN SOFTWARE FOR EASY MAINTENANCE
Samsung's Magician software includes business-friendly features that make it easy for IT managers to monitor and maintain the health of the 840 PRO Series SSD, including Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology (SMART) Support.

PRODUCT AND WARRANTY INFORMATION
This SSD has a usable capacity of 512 GB, offers 512 MB of Samsung DDR2 SDRAM cache memory, and has a SATA 6b/s interface that is compatible with SATA 3 Gb/s and SATA 1.5 Gb/s. It measures 7.00 by 69.85 by 100.00 millimeters (H x W x D) and weighs 62.5 grams.

The 840 PRO Series SSD is backed by a five-year warranty.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
840 PRO Series SSD, Samsung Smart Data Migration Software, Samsung SSD Magician software and manual CD, and quick user manual.
